activity_a.text:
Remember we often use these or similar time markers in the sentences in the Simple Past Tense. 
අපි සාමාන්‍ය භූත කාලයේ වාක්‍යවලදී මෙම හෝ සමාන කාල සලකුණු බොහෝ විට භාවිතා කරන බව මතක තබා ගන්න.

activity_b.text:
Choose the correct form of the verb 'to be'. Use the past tense only when the time markers clearly indicate that the action happened in the past.
ක්‍රියා පදය 'to be' හි නිවැරදි ආකාරය තෝරන්න. කාල සලකුණු පැහැදිලිව ක්‍රියාව භූත කාලයේ සිදු වූ බව පෙන්වන්නේ නම් පමණක් භූත කාලය භාවිතා කරන්න.
வினைச்சொல் 'to be' இன் சரியான வடிவத்தைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும். நேர குறியீடுகள் நடவடிக்கை கடந்த காலத்தில் நடந்தது என்பதை தெளிவாகக் காட்டும் போது மட்டுமே கடந்த காலத்தைப் பயன்படுத்தவும்.

activity_c.text: There are many causes of accidents like negligence, unsafe work areas, misuse of tools and equipment and failure to use protective equipment.
Here are six common causes of accidents.
Unsafe housekeeping: injuries from slips and trips are common in unsafe work areas.
Holes, spills, garbage, debris, improperly stored items: poor housekeeping causes slips and trips.
When garbage and tools are left lying around, or holes are not covered, accidents can happen quickly.
Falling hazards: a fall is bound to happen when someone repeatedly fails to look where they are going.
Other falling hazards lurk on stairwells with loose guardrails, or with things stored on the steps.
A simple fall can be life changing, or even fatal.
Misuse of stepladders: a tipped over stepladder is a leading cause of injury or long term disability.
Failure to set the feet on solid level ground or using the top steps can lead to fatal falls.
Don’t leave tools on a stepladder, they hurt when they fall off.
Misusing a stepladder may not seem dangerous, but it can lead to a permanent disability.
